event.name: Holiday Party
proTips: Red wine outsells white 2:1 at winter holidays - adjust accordingly.
Festive signature cocktails are expected - plan for mixers like cranberry juice and eggnog.
70% of champagne at NYE is consumed between 11:30pm and 12:15am - time your chilling.
Warm drinks like mulled wine and hot toddies are crowd pleasers in cold months.
People drink 20% more at company holiday parties than other corporate events.
event.buyingGuide: Holiday parties call for festive options. Stock extra red wine and have ingredients for 1-2 seasonal cocktails (mulled wine, spiked cider, or classic eggnog). For NYE specifically, double your champagne order and have everything chilled by 11pm.

meta.title: How Much Beer for 20 Guest Holiday Party? | 4 cases
meta.description: Need beer for a 20-person holiday party? You'll need exactly 4 cases. Free calculator with pro tips from experienced bartenders.
meta.h1: How Much Beer for a 20 Guest Holiday Party?

mathExplanation.label: Estimate actual drinkers
mathExplanation.explanation: At small events, about 80% of guests typically drink alcohol.

mathExplanation.label: Calculate base consumption
mathExplanation.explanation: Industry standard is 1.5 drinks per person per hour for a 4-hour event.

mathExplanation.label: Apply consumption decay
mathExplanation.formula: Adjusted for drinking slowdown over time (decay factor: 3.25)
mathExplanation.explanation: People drink faster in the first hour and slow down as the event progresses.

mathExplanation.label: Apply holiday party modifier
mathExplanation.explanation: Holiday Partys typically consume 10% less beer than average.

mathExplanation.label: Convert to cases
mathExplanation.explanation: Each case of beer provides 24 servings.

mathExplanation.label: Add 15% buffer & round up
mathExplanation.explanation: Always round up and add a buffer. Running out is worse than having leftovers!
